Chenggong Ridge 158T 101 Brigade 4th Battalion Boot Camp Reflection When writing this article, it has been about a month and a half since the end of boot camp, and there is still one month left before discharge. While the memory is not too distant, I record my impressions and thoughts on boot camp.
Preface To be honest, until the month before I served in the army, I really didn’t think I would come in to serve as a regular soldier. At least since the physical examination, I maintained that after a few more re-examinations, I should be able to use flat feet to be a twelve-day supplementary soldier. In January of this year (2022), I got several pre-employment R&D alternate service offers, and probably thought that after graduation I should just go to the substitute service camp to sing songs and prepare to go to work. Later, I decided to go to a foreign company without R&D alternate service, and still felt that there should be a chance to be a supplementary soldier, because in August and September, my BMI once soared over 29, not far from the supplementary soldier standard. Who knew that later trapped in the deep waters of graduate school, a conscription order became the graduation password. Thinking about it is also absurd, never thought that one day I would look forward to the arrival of the conscription order so much.
In my echo chamber, most people disapprove of spending four months serving in the army. Those who have served all think it is a waste of time, pulling weeds or cleaning every day, plus watching a group of idiot officers play tricks. Those with a master’s degree will also think that going to serve as R&D substitute service or even six months of general substitute service is better than four months without freedom. People who haven’t served might be able to say things like four months will pass quickly. Once you actually come in, you will regret how time can pass so slowly. Even now with only the last month left, I still feel that coming in is mostly a waste of time, only receiving 6000 yuan per month, which is really tragic compared to the salary outside.
Unexpectedly, my family was unusually excited about serving in the army. In their traditional concept, serving in the army is the real coming-of-age ceremony. For young people who think about going abroad all day, this may be the last chance to cultivate patriotism and love for the people. Plus the increasingly bloated figure during graduate school, going in for exercise should be friendly to health. Later when the conscription order came down and they knew I was going to Chenggong Ridge for boot camp, my father was even more excited. He served as an obligatory sergeant at Chenggong Ridge for nearly two years back then. Chenggong Ridge is a place where he invested his youth and is full of memories. It’s a pity that there is no family visit, otherwise it would be a good opportunity for him to come back and reminisce.
From knowing that I might have a chance to serve in the army, to confirming which batch I was assigned to, and then getting the conscription order, all this happened within a month. There was no time to think, no time to change mindset. After discussing with the professor, I started running the graduation process. In between, stuck a five-day trip to Penghu, so that I was still arranging the oral defense time at night in the homestay. Returned from Penghu and spent a week completing the oral defense and leaving school procedures, and got the diploma on 9/19. Then three days later, on 9/21, I boarded the enlistment special train to Chenggong Ridge and started four months (16 weeks) of military life.
Preparation Since being busy with graduation was already overwhelming enough, I waited until I got my diploma to start thinking about serving in the army. Compared to some peers who may have waited for the conscription order for half a year, my preparation time was relatively very short. I roughly divided the preparation part into items and mentality, both are equally important.
Essential Items Someone on the Internet said that you can actually enlist with just a wallet, because whatever you will use can be bought or obtained inside. This is true, but if you want to be more comfortable, it is better to prepare more things.
Toiletries Toothbrush - Recommend bringing a few more. I brought an old one for the first week and it broke after two days, I could only ask for help from peers. Toothpaste - Bring a bigger tube, better than having none to use. 3-in-1 Shower Gel - Adidas is good to use, convenient is good, don’t be too particular. Electric Shaver - Before going in, someone said electric ones cannot be brought. Chenggong Ridge seems to allow it. Much more convenient than manual ones. Towel - No need to bring, the railing by the bed can only hang the officially issued one. Clothing Underwear - Recommend bringing some more. Although there are issued ones, you may not be used to wearing them. Sometimes you may not be able to wash them on the same day. Undershirt - No need to bring, can only wear issued camouflage undershirt. Warm Clothing - When the weather is cold, you can wear thermal underwear or a jacket inside the camouflage jacket. Casual Clothes - You can only wear casual clothes when going out for holidays. Laundry Bag - No need to bring, will be issued inside. Medicine Vitamins - Can bring some Vitamin B or C. Can eat some when it’s tiring, recover faster. Analgesic Antipyretic Tablets - Very often catch a cold and have a headache inside, can eat a little to relieve symptoms. Band-Aid - Can use for injuries or blisters. Salonpas Spray - Can use for muscle soreness. Peppermint Oil - Can use for headache. Miscellaneous Wet Wipes - Bring cooling wet wipes, it’s a godsend when the weather is hot. Wiping once before nap makes it easy to sleep. Books - Most of the time inside is spent waiting. Taking books out to read usually won’t be a problem. Power Bank - Although time using mobile phone is very little, having a power bank can prevent phone from running out of power. Baby Powder - Can use when weather is hot. Small Fan - It is usually very hot inside the mosquito net, and most of the time the air conditioning cannot blow in. Flashlight - Usually need to get up early in the morning to organize internal affairs, but cannot turn on the light, can only rely on flashlight. Earplugs - Must bring for target practice, and easy to lose. Not wearing earplugs for target practice will make your ears ring for a week, I experienced it personally. Pen - Ballpoint pen and permanent marker are needed. Better to have more because they are often lost. Used for writing Big Soldier diary or filling out forms. Food Drinks - Usually not allowed to buy drinks from vending machines first few days after entering. Snacks - Same logic, eat some when homesick. Chewing Gum - Can eat when bored, but don’t be too high profile. Documents Original Conscription Order - Will be very troublesome if not brought. Copy of Diploma - Just bring the highest degree, because degree will be used to distinguish drawing lots batches. Certificate of Service Period Deduction - This needs to be applied for at the school military instruction office. Best to get it done before going in. Copy of Household Certificate - Wasn’t used later. Personal Chop - Spend some money to carve one, will be collected after entering. Money Miscellaneous Fees - First week will collect a lot of money, like laundry fee, hair cutting fee, issued items fee etc. Small Change - Will be used for vending machines and making phone calls. Phone Card - Don’t think there are many opportunities to use mobile phone. In boot camp stage you can only rely on phone card to contact outside world. Calling mobile phone is very expensive, suggest preparing more. Mentality Adjustment This is very difficult
First of course is to convince yourself why you are here to serve these four months. Then is to understand what is done in each stage in the army, can relieve fear of ignorance. Before enlisting I kept watching Ah Zhe Soldier videos, inside explains very clearly what happens every week in boot camp. Knowing more can convince yourself that the most painful part has passed. Then can chat more with friends who have finished serving, understand how to relieve depression, how to get along with peers and officers. I feel my mentality wasn’t completely adjusted when I went in, and also spent a lot of time adapting to the rhythm inside. Also, never bring outside things inside to complete, like preparing for exams, applying for schools or completing research etc. You will find that you can’t do anything inside. That sense of powerlessness is terrible. Life I can verify positively that boot camp is absolutely the most, most, most painful period of time in the four months, especially the first ten days after entering. After surviving it, it will be like eating sugarcane, getting sweeter and smoother.
About Chenggong Ridge and 101 Brigade My Unit My assigned batch is Army 158T Military Training Service, assigned unit is 101 Brigade 4th Battalion Firepower Company. It is said it is called Firepower Company because we are the fourth infantry company in this battalion. To avoid the word four, it was renamed Firepower Company. In the past it was called Weapons Company, don’t know why it was changed to Firepower Company.
There are about 150 military training soldiers in the company. Company level has Company Commander, Political Warfare Officer, Company Sergeant Major. Those responsible for managing us are several sergeants below Staff Sergeant taking turns being on duty. Can observe that the company is often understaffed, often only two or three sergeants managing 150 soldiers. Can be said to be willing but unable, often feel hard for them.
About Chenggong Ridge Chenggong Ridge is an old boot camp center. The entire camp area is responsible for receiving new recruits. Very, very few combat units. Can feel that equipment in Chenggong Ridge is older, more biased towards training purposes.
Traditionally Chenggong Ridge has 302 and 104 two brigades. Later after 101 Brigade was reinstated, it borrowed the original 104 Brigade barracks to station. Chenggong Ridge camp area is very large. Unless there are special reasons, moving around is by foot. When practicing target shooting, often walk from 104 to 302, takes about 30 minutes, and have to wear full gear with heavy T65k2 rifle. Very tiring.
The first floor of barracks usually has vending machines. This is the only place where we can freely buy things. There are also several camp stores and convenience stores inside the camp area. These are usually visible but not reachable. Only when going out for official duty can beg officers to take us there. So people who finished official duty will have bulging pockets.
Chenggong Ridge also has a substitute service training class. Usually pass by on the way to target practice. But suggest not to observe their life, mood will be bad. Their life is colorful, while ours is camouflage…
Transportation in Chenggong Ridge is very, very convenient compared to other camp areas. Ten minutes walk from the main gate to Chenggong Train Station. Spending fifty yuan to take a taxi, can reach High Speed Rail station within ten minutes. In addition, thousands of people go out together when Chenggong Ridge has a holiday. Many people and there is a level crossing right at the gate. To prevent clogging when going out the gate, usually run out. Very spectacular.
Enlistment On enlistment day, gathered at Taipei Main Station lobby. After gathering, people from district office will send everyone to the special train to Chenggong Ridge. That process is unforgettable forever. Hundreds of sad-faced boys gathered in the lobby, one look and you know what suffering they are going to encounter.
The enlistment special train is a Ju-Guang train that drives very slowly. Slow enough to have time to eat a very terrible bento in the middle. Please remember this bento, because this will be the only warm food from the outside world you can eat for these ten days. About three hours later the train will arrive at New Wuri Station. Transfer to bus directly into Chenggong Ridge camp area. Then will gather and be assigned to respective companies.
Followed by assigning seat numbers. Everyone will circulate rumors to stand back as much as possible, don’t stand in the front row, because will be squad leader. I just happened to become number 005. The schedule on the first day will be very tight. First is security check (body search), arranging organization, issuing equipment, arranging beds, simply teaching everyone how to organize internal affairs. From this time on we have to say goodbye to our mobile phones, start primitive life.
Enlistment Special Train
Schedule Life in the unit is very regular. If there are no special things, daily schedule is about the same. Therefore quite easy to grasp what will happen next. During boot camp period we live on summer time. Daily schedule is roughly as follows:
05:30 Wake Up - Although schedule says wake up at this time, usually have to get up earlier to fold quilt, mosquito net and wash up. These jobs actually take quite some time. 05:50 Assembly - If nothing special, wear sports uniform and go downstairs to assemble at company assembly ground (the open space at barracks entrance). Suggest going down ten minutes earlier, because 05:50 is time for assembly completion, but someone is late every time. 06:00 ~ 06:30 Breakfast - Because many people, cafeteria cannot sit everyone, so we will split into two batches for cafeteria. When one batch goes to eat, the other batch will do environment cleaning. Breakfast usually is a bun with some dishes and tea. Occasionally there will be things like hamburgers. 07:00 Assembly - This assembly requires full gear (helmet, S-belt). 07:10 ~ 10:30 Training Class - Will have class according to schedule of the day. Things learned are mostly things that will be tested in assessment. 11:00 Assembly - Yes, you will find you did nothing and going to eat again. 11:00 ~ 12:00 Lunch - Lunch has four dishes and one soup plus fruit. Standard is about same as elementary school nutritious lunch. 12:30 ~ 13:50 Nap - Since nothing to do can only sleep or read books. I usually go make a public phone call to girlfriend before nap. 14:00 Assembly - Same also full gear. 14:10 ~ 16:30 Training Class - Continue doing things similar to morning. 17:00 Assembly - Time to eat again. 17:00 ~ 18:00 Dinner - Eating same things as lunch. Dishes often not enough to eat. 18:00 ~ 19:00 Washing Up - At this time everyone will rush to grab showers. 150 people rushing for 20 showers easily causes traffic jam. Also will set up mosquito net on bed, to make sleeping time faster at night. 19:00 Assembly - By this time most people finished showering. Wear sports uniform and assemble. Sometimes in Zhongshan room sometimes on company assembly ground. 19:00 ~ 21:00 Night Class - Most of the time doing some very redundant things. Like collecting some money, data or issuing equipment. Other time just spacing out. Occasionally will give mobile phones, but probability is very low. Duty Officer The duty officer of the week will largely determine if you live comfortably that week. Duty rotation order will be published on schedule. Can know who is on duty next, be mentally prepared. Duty officer usually hands over on Thursday afternoon. Each time there will be a Company Duty Officer responsible for leading training progress, there will be a Duty Squad Leader responsible for roll call and managing unit order. Being on duty feels like a very tiring job. One or two people manage 150 soldiers often cannot take care of everything. Officers on duty all want to get out quickly.
Good duty officer has clear standards, strict in appropriate situations, won’t play with soldiers arbitrarily. Bad duty officer has inconsistent standards, poor efficiency, drag everyone’s rest time. The week when it’s turn for bad or inexperienced duty officer will be smoky and full of complaints.
Welfare Things that are taken for granted outside will be a kind of welfare inside.
Rest Time - Don’t doubt, they treat giving soldiers rest as a kind of welfare. You have to be more obedient to give you more rest time. Please remember the famous saying from squad leader’s mouth: “You cooperate with me, I cooperate with you, your rest time will only become more and more.” Vending Machine - Although there are vending machines downstairs every building, doesn’t mean we have right to use vending machines. Officers will open vending machines depending on order. We started having right to use vending machines on third day. And not all vending machines can be used, only can use vending machine belonging to own company. Smoking - I don’t smoke, but share anyway. Smoking is also a welfare. Our company let people smoke on the second day. Everyone is afraid some people will start naughty without cigarettes. Smoking time is usually after lunch and dinner, gather at a place to smoke collectively. Since lighters are prohibited items, can only get from squad leader. Scene of dozen people borrowing fire from each other is very interesting. Mobile Phone - Too little mobile phone time should be the place everyone most dissatisfied. We should only use mobile phone once or twice a week, about ten to twenty minutes each time. Usually when mobile phone cannot be used, locked in phone cabinet. Can see but cannot touch. In this era people addicted to mobile phones should be more than people addicted to cigarettes. Should be reasonable to give mobile phone opportunity comparable to smoking. Mobile phone needs to install National Army MDM to be used in camp area. Will help everyone install first few days. MDM software will lock camera and GPS. Can unlock after going out of camp area on holiday. Suggest trying not to bring non-ios phones in. MDM will be harder to install. Sometimes will affect your precious mobile phone usage time. Camp Store - Chenggong Ridge has three or four camp stores. Except for first day when taken collectively to buy daily necessities, likely won’t have opportunity to go again, unless on official duty. Chenggong Ridge recently renovating, so many moving things and cleaning jobs need manpower. Most of the time halfway through work officer will take us to camp store to buy something. Considered an unwritten welfare. Punishment Where there is welfare there is punishment. And punishment can be collective or individual. Collective punishment is commonly known as Collective Responsibility. Several people in group behave poorly, will sequentially deprive above collective punishments. Let those few people be hated by everyone. For occasional especially disorderly behavior will have individual punishment. However since Hung Chung-chiu incident, corporal punishment is explicitly prohibited in army. Using running, push-ups etc. as punishment are all very serious behaviors. Should be no officer dare to take this risk. So adopt more static punishment methods. Below list punishment methods they can adopt:
Confession Letter - This is first step of all punishments. Is a blank form asking you to write what bad things you did. After writing officer will punish further according to situation. Sometimes might just be bird things like clothes not worn, assembly late. To make up a thousand words is also painful enough. So often hear squad leader say: “Whoever XXX again send one confession letter each person, do what I say” 08 - If did something relatively serious wrong like late returning from holiday, mostly punishment start from holiday time. When we were in boot camp mostly could leave camp before Friday 18:00. Being punished 08 means can only leave camp next day 08:00. Thinking of sleeping alone in huge dormitory feels pitiful. Penalty Duty - If you are 08 holiday that week, but you did foolish thing again, then might be penalty duty. Penalty duty once two hours. So you might become 10:00 to leave camp. Every minute of freedom outside is important when serving in army. Never joke with your holiday. If reached illegal level, it is said directly forced to stay in camp until discharge, also accept military law trial. So never do bad things.
Activity Space In boot camp stage, new recruits have completely no freedom. All our free activity space is limited to the floor belonging to company, including corridor toilet and dormitory. And only can move during rest time. Wanting to go downstairs or move to other places in camp area must be led by officer. Otherwise being spotted will be big trouble.
In addition, between companies, between battalions have very clear boundaries. Like cannot use toilet of other companies, cannot walk stairs of other companies, cannot cross central corridor of other battalions, walk assembly ground of other battalions etc.
Internal Affairs In boot camp stage everything has to be regulated. Where to put what things how to put, how to fold quilt, what things can put cannot put etc. Order of shoe tray shoes cannot be wrong. Washbasin can only put toothbrush toothpaste. Toothbrush must be inserted in steel cup dirty enough used by unknown number of people. Direction facing must be same side. Towel can only hang officially issued label facing inside. In inner affairs cabinet clothes can only hang jackets and camouflage uniforms. Sleeves also need to be tied up. Cabinet top can only put helmet and S-belt. Mosquito net and quilt have fixed folding method. Edges and corners need to be pulled square like tofu. Only thing can be messy is inside Yellow Pu bag. If above not done well considered internal affairs not tidy. Too messy then sorry 08.
Recruitment Obligatory service is key recruitment target of National Army. At beginning of boot camp people from other units will come to camp to persuade everyone to sign voluntary service. They will come to introduce their unit location work and welfare. Usually will put on good food eaten everyday and newly built barracks to attract everyone. Also will promote stability of National Army salary and benefits of pension. In addition will also say now National Army all have eating and sleeping outside. Similar to working outside. However whether it is really so good is left for people who really signed to experience. Only know very few people can endure humiliation and burden for twenty years.
Whole recruitment link luck good will last two three days. These few days no need training class. If you show willingness to sign after hearing, recruiter will pull you out for interview separately. Sometimes will even give you mobile phone, go to camp store etc. benefits. In addition if you almost decided to sign, first holiday can release 12 holiday i.e. leave camp Friday noon. Saying let you go convince parents let you sign. So also quite a lot of people pretend want to sign during this period. Try to get some benefits.
After recruitment period ends will see peers who signed can enjoy various benefits like using mobile phone during rest time, playing ball time. Sometimes also no need to follow training class. Can only say National Army uses every means to attract everyone to join. But no need to envy them too much. They just cool for these few days. After phase two down to unit is another world.
Holiday Holiday is the only chance for obligatory service to return to society outside. Unlike voluntary service occasionally can eat and sleep outside a bit. Obligatory service holiday in principle is rest when see red. So consecutive holidays rest as usual, make-up work make-up as usual. Boot camp first ten days no holiday. Afterward will make up two days holiday back. So first ten days are most painful. No freedom no mobile phone information completely separated from outside world. Our batch luckier just met Double Ten consecutive holiday. Plus two days holiday not taken. Our first three holidays were all consecutive three days. Considering this batch are all Taipei soldiers. Distance far. First three holidays also let us off 18 holiday. Therefore there were few weeks only trained four days class. Already lived quite well compared to other batches. Only last week off 08 holiday. Result caused public anger of peers. But military training service holiday time originally is Saturday 08. So nothing good to argue.
Chenggong Ridge holiday in and out all walk main gate. That is the section with road to success sign. Holiday will collectively lead team walk from barracks to main gate. Will first divide into taking taxi, Chenggong Train Station, parent pickup three blocks lead team separately. If going to High Speed Rail station walk taxi route. Then take taxi to High Speed Rail station 50 yuan per person. Short five minutes journey one car full can carry seven people. Actually quite profitable. High Speed Rail round trip Taipei is 700. So monthly 6000 yuan actually not quite enough for fare.
Returning from holiday enter from another closer gate. Suggest arriving Taichung High Speed Rail station early. Sometimes many people no taxi. And taxi cannot drive directly to gate. Only can drop off near gate. Remaining section of road walk in about 20 minutes. So try to be early for everything. Late returning from holiday is very serious. Also don’t make trouble on road walking into camp area. Will have officers patrolling. Being spotted also confession letter one sheet.
Training Class Since boot camp time is very short, training class items focus on assessment items. Basic attire for training class is helmet + S-belt. Most training classes not tiring. About junior high school PE class level. And after some incidents officers also don’t dare to train soldiers randomly. You propose (dizziness, foot pain etc.) basically will let you rest. Going to toilet same just say will let you go. They also afraid you complain him. Weather influence more terrible than officers. Didn’t encounter rain in Chenggong Ridge. Considered very lucky. Heard other units individual combat in rain. Getting mud all over body. Summer sun is terrible. Can only rely on drinking water to cool down. Training classes I experienced roughly have following:
Opening Ceremony Fifth day just entered will have an opening ceremony. Is bringing all Chenggong Ridge new recruits to assembly ground to sunbathe. Will have high officials like Brigade Commander to watch. During period will have to read some soldier oath. To proceed opening smoothly. Will spend whole morning practicing organizing team and standing at attention. Sun still very big in September. Should be quite a lot of people heatstroke from sun.
Bayonet Charge Bayonet charge can be said to be most important item of assessment. But compared to target practice, individual combat actually quite useless. Same set of things hasn’t changed for thirty forty years. This era on battlefield also should be very hard to rely on bayonet technique to stab enemy to death. Understanding as a team performance might be more acceptable. Can show team tacit understanding and morale. Can refer to Rookie Diary Bayonet Charge clip.
Bayonet charge whole performance about five minutes. Will take about three to four mornings to practice. Will see group of people holding T65k2 rifles turning around shouting “Kill!”. Most terrible part of practicing bayonet charge lies in extending hand straight to hold gun when stabbing gun out. When practicing continuous movement squad leader sometimes deliberately doesn’t call next movement. Rifle very heavy. About four kilograms. Maintaining state of stabbing gun out tests arm muscle endurance very much. Hand can be sour for several days after practice. In addition team tacit understanding also needs time to cultivate. Like scattering and assembling. Also bayonet charge flow needs to be familiar. Watching other companies stab can still see people stab wrong side, slow half beat or run wrong place when positioning.
Grenade Grenade throwing can be divided into two parts: basic throwing and field throwing. Basic throwing is simpler. Just throw a practice grenade about 500 grams into a fan-shaped area then lie down. Actually throwing is quite difficult. Small practice grenade heavier than imagined. Usually if not throwing things, hard to apply force correctly will throw not far. Therefore some people can easily throw very far some people throw very hard still not into 25 meters. Training class will first explain steps and throwing method. But no one understands. Actually as long as can throw out. Movement random throw also fine. But surely remember to lie down. Not lie down will definitely be blasted by squad leader. Grenade class considered very relaxed. Only one venue. One company 150 people one person go up throw one or two times three hours passed. Other time just sit on bench watch others throw.
More interesting is sometimes go compete throwing grenade with other companies. Will pick few stronger ones from company to represent. Lose whole company do push-ups 30 times. Once won squad leader even treated people who went up to throw drinks. Considered more interesting part in boredom.
Field is to throw grenade into a square window. Simulating situation of attacking enemy hiding place in actual combat. Field throwing very hard to throw in without practice. After all only touched practice grenade once or twice. To accurately control throwing direction and force very difficult. Remember only five or six people in whole company really threw in.
Target Practice Target practice uses National Army T65K2 rifle to shoot human-shaped target. Can be divided into 25 meters zeroing shooting and 175 meters shooting. Distance farther shooting difficulty higher. Boot camp target practice all adopt prone position. But heard actually not much used in actual combat.
Because guns plus bullets are very dangerous. Range strictly requires discipline. Cannot laugh play sleep randomly. Also have to be very familiar with shooting flow. Therefore before target practice will do shooting preview several times. Which is simulating target practice flow. Including how to prone shoot correctly, how to open safety, how to aim, how to press gun, how to load bullets, how to clear check gun. And commands on range like what left line ready right line ready.
Make sure everyone knows then will take to range for formal shooting. Battalion commander company commander will all be there when target shooting. Usually company commander serves as shooting commander. Will give shooting commands. Range usually has several target positions. One target position corresponds to one human-shaped target. Beside target position will have range assistant assist shooting. Help catch shell casing hand magazine and prevent you from doing outrageous foolish things. Before going up to shoot will arrange wave target position. Shoot wave by wave up target platform. Each time will shoot about one to three magazines. Each time about six bullets. Thought gun recoil huge before shooting. Actually okay. Sound is very loud. Louder than all firecrackers you heard. Therefore target practice must wear earplugs. Once I forgot to wear earplugs for target practice. Ears rang directly after first shot. Ringing feeling only eliminated after a week.
Target practice itself actually not tiring. Most time at range waiting for others to finish shooting. And because range discipline stricter. Cannot chat cannot do other things. Very boring. Target practice more tiring is preparation work. Prior need to pick up gun from warehouse. Then check gun. Range is at Chenggong Ridge 302. Carry heavy rifle walk thirty minutes from barracks. Walk until tired. Finish shooting take team walk back. Check gun clear gun again. Then send gun at night. Sometimes have to queue gun sentry guard gun. Often waste whole day for shooting.
Individual Combat Individual combat is simulating really going to battlefield to fight. Considered more useful class. Boot camp receives rifleman training. And rifleman role is to annihilate enemy firepower on ground. And individual combat teaches everyone how to use alternating fire cover. Attack forward towards enemy.
Individual combat field looks like a forest. Then will arrange several stations. Each station will have several situations. Such as have barbed wire, have trench how to cover each other pass. When our side someone injured how to rescue him and send back. And when two armies engage how to charge forward. Among there will be very many report words to memorize. Remember also memorized for several days. Result actual assessment different from what everyone memorized. Ran through all individual combat in a mess.
Actually doing will have quite a lot parts need to lie on ground or crawl forward. Therefore be mentally prepared whole body covered with mud and strange bugs crawl on body. During assessment will also set up machine gun tower firing blank ammo and use TNT to simulate mortar. Scene very shocking. Can slightly feel battlefield situation.
Assessment Last week of boot camp is assessment week. About three days will conduct assessment. Meaning of assessment is to test whether unit has combat ability. Test includes physical fitness and combat skills. Physical fitness is push-ups, sit-ups and 3000 meters. Combat skills is bayonet charge, grenade, individual combat and target practice. Assessment doing things just doing things done in training class again. Just beside will have instructor from test center to supervise. Assessment officer will be stricter. Actually still going through a motion. After all five weeks time really hard to say every item practiced very skillfully. Officer also understands this. Therefore also doesn’t care too much about grades. Only care whether tried best to participate and whether order is good.
As for whether pass assessment makes any difference. One saying is pass will be easier to be call-up. But also some people say fail easier to call-up. Anyway just an urban legend. Only certain thing is assessment record will stay until unit, call-up until discharge. Later discovered by people assessment failed should be a bit shameful. So better try best to pass. As for physical fitness really cannot or really don’t want to sunburn there is exempt skill test move. Can find a chronic illness on body (flat feet, old injury, high blood pressure etc.) can go to National Army Hospital (Note not Tri-Service General Hospital nor Veterans General Hospital) open exempt skill test certificate. Haven’t heard anyone failed yet. Have exempt skill test certificate these three days just watch others skill test. Even more absolute can say body uncomfortable first day of assessment. Officer won’t force you must complete test. Anyway soldier is about honor.
Official Duty During our boot camp other units preparing to renovate barracks. Need strictly large amount of people help move. Just happen obligatory service is cheapest labor. Therefore we have many opportunities to go on official duty. Boot camp stage official duty must go. Because not going is training class. Training class boredom level not as interesting as moving things. In addition official duty sometimes have welfare. Like vending machine, smoking, camp store etc. Also can take this opportunity to look at other places in camp area.
Drawing Lots Don’t know from which batch phase two training need to go to other units. Then had this drawing lots link. Drawing lots everyone most afraid is drawing Golden Horse Prize. And current drawing lots system will first let people who really want to go to outlying islands volunteer priority. Remaining quota then let everyone draw. Surprisingly volunteer outlying islands registration quite enthusiastic. Probably think go only more than two months. Treat as working holiday in outlying islands should be nice. Except outlying islands. Maybe considering this batch all Taipei soldiers. Other lots almost all northern lots. Few farther ones like Hualien. Drawing lots link is everyone go up to lot cylinder draw a number plate. Someone will tell you drew what lot. More interesting is after drawing everyone ask each other what drew and find companion for next unit. Also somewhat sentimental. Drawing lots decided boot camp companions sharing weal and woe phase two training also separate. Phase two training compared to boot camp will be much relaxed. So actually most lots result actually similar. At most accommodation environment better or closer to home. I later drew Hsinchu Hukou Armored 584 Brigade. Already considered lot farther from Taipei. Later have chance write feeling about phase two training.
Reflection Say unreservedly boot camp is the most, most, most hard period of time in these four months. Still remember girlfriend suddenly confirmed diagnosed could not send me to serve army before enlistment. Let my every day next only spiritual pillar is time calling her public phone every day. Everyday besides solid training class make muscle sore. Next is just deprived freedom from free world instantly. Managed by others like elementary student. Really makes people doubt life. Doubt myself why waste four months managed by people. Regret why chose substitute service. In addition deprived mobile phone. Completely disjointed from outside information. What happened changed outside this month nothing can know. Lack of information very terrifying. Cannot contact girlfriend, family, friends moment to moment also makes people anxious. Also happen to approach election. What that candidate did said we also cannot know. Maybe because deprived freedom. Make people cherish value of freedom more. Cherish holiday time. Also warn myself don’t do bad things.
Although officer management standard inconsistent, work efficiency extremely poor. Food terrible and often not enough to eat. This is still an unforgettable time. In hard times remember any interesting people things more. Without coming in to serve army might never know people of other backgrounds in society. Very hard to communicate with them without stereotype. And serving army broke barrier. Let me have broader understanding of this society. Now looking back. One month boot camp is absurd yet interesting. Boring yet meaningful.
Me one week after enlistment
Below record some unforgettable people things in boot camp:
Unforgettable Things 0600 Winter time is 6:00 wake up. Every day wake up duty squad leader will broadcast: “Current time 0600, Firepower Company wake up.”, this probably most unwanted sound for all new recruits. This means leaving dreamland. Get up wash fold mosquito net quilt. Welcome another boring day. It is said after discharge still some people subconsciously exist fear of Reveille. Hearing this sound still cannot help but nervous.
Fearing this sound not without reason. Boot camp stage quite a lot of people sleep not very well. Even 09:30 force everyone lie on bed. Still various reasons can make people can’t sleep. Like weather hot mosquito net hangs. Air conditioning or fan basically can’t blow in. Will make people hot to unable sleep. Also snoring sound of peer often annoying. Result actual sleeping time only left about five six hours.
Bench Military training service carry-on equipment besides helmet, S-belt, water bottle. Also one must carry is bench. Provided by our company is a plastic square bench. When marching can just jam body waist carry with left hand. Whether training class, listening lecture recruitment or going to restaurant eat bench is essential item. Otherwise you can only sit on ground. Therefore we self-mock bench is our real organic weapon. Worthy of First of Seven Weapons.
Bench makes people so impressive. Besides accompany us one month. Also commands related to bench. Like sitting bench cannot sit directly. Wait for squad leader command “Place bench”. Place bench behind heel hand touch bench look at squad leader. Hear “Good” then can sit. At this time definitely have fool haven’t heard good sit. Will be scolded by squad leader then back to previous move. Like this place bench game sometimes can play ten minutes.
Confirmed Diagnosis In normal world accidentally confirmed diagnosed covid-19 might be very worried. Because quarantined several days (at that time quarantine seven days) cannot go out. However in army confirmed diagnosis basically like winning lottery. At this time army policy is once confirmed diagnosis go home isolate seven days until rapid test positive can return. In addition close contact of same bed also can isolate seven days. Can take seven days holiday who wants to stay in boring unit. Therefore every time collective rapid test pray self or same bed rapid test plate can appear two lines. And people who hit really cheer like winning lottery. Will definitely be scolded by squad leader. But going out to easy seven days. Who cares.
Have to say army really is big virus den. More than one hundred people squeezed in small dormitory. Virus not spread also difficult. So first week appeared massive confirmed diagnosis. Plus same bed close contact about 60 people quarantined. My organic squad originally had 17 people. After first week only left five people including me. Originally thought 005 should be nothing related to squad leader. Result 001-004 all quarantined. I was forced to be squad leader more than week. Although squad leader also nothing to do. Since close contact will be quarantined. Someone in company originally close contact isolate seven days isolate finish find confirmed diagnosis isolate another seven days. Seven days later still not turn negative continue isolate. Result five weeks boot camp actual stay less than one week. Easy makes people envy.
Rice Not Enough Army food roughly junior high school nutritious lunch level. Won’t be hard to swallow but didn’t delicious to memorable. Compared to dish delicious or not everyone cares more is dish enough or not. Whole company has 150 people share that few five buckets of dish can be said monks many gruel little. Need someone strictly control everyone’s dish amount. Therefore also need special adding dish link let those appetite bigger add some dish eat fuller. However also often have fool steal dish when squad leader haven’t shouted add dish. Later of course scolded.
Later weeks of boot camp. Dish not enough situation more and more serious. Not our appetite getting bigger. But kitchen share us less and less dish. Later less than half people serve dish gone. Therefore someone called 1985 because of this. 1985 is National Army complaint phone. Just to avoid officer misconduct after Hung Chung-chiu incident. Once receive 1985 complaint. Superior officer must handle this matter. Therefore sometimes used as one of means revenge officer. Because dish not enough call 1985 also have this meaning. Therefore day of incident officer also agreed take us to camp store supplement nutrition. Later this matter went to brigade headquarters. Even brigade political warfare director came to concern this matter. He probably thought very baffling even this kind of matter call 1985. Or say “This is normal channel reflecting situation”. But still hope we can first reflect to company officer. They probably also think this kind of matter annoying.
Holiday Return Serving army most unforgettable probably holiday return time. Holiday rejoice self about to obtain short freedom time. RETURN lament why holiday passed so fast. And return with peer also make this matter become more interesting. Since High Speed Rail station to camp area take taxi. Peers often agree meet at High Speed Rail station. Eat Mos Burger or McDonald together. Enjoy last freedom time. Then take taxi. Walk into most unwanted return Chenggong Ridge camp area. On road everyone chat what played what ate during holiday. Then guess next week whether happy or painful. Outside everyone more or less have a career. Back to camp area just left a number. This transition road someone accompany also not that painful.
Dropping Chopsticks Boot camp stage up down restaurant collective lead team. In marching process as long as someone drops chopsticks. Sound will be very loud. At this time everyone knows someone chopsticks dropped. Interesting is from first day of boot camp to last day always someone cannot hold chopsticks well. Looks like Chenggong Ridge should think a way let everyone chopsticks not drop.
Squad Leader Emotional Blackmail Squad leader also human. Some squad leaders mood not good and glass heart. Boot camp time very short. And teach many assessment items. For squad leader already collapse enough. Among individual combat is hardest subject. Teach time only two mornings. Content very much. And squad leader teach very tired new recruits listen not listen. Teach second day squad leader probably teach very unhappy. Just directly said he doesn’t want to teach ran to smoke. Later scolded by duty officer plus prone on ground prone thirty minutes. Squad leader willing continue come back teach finish. Naturally learning effect very poor. Assessment everyone running randomly.
Constipation Army environment very magical. Once come in several days won’t want poop. Probably because army life too tight. Anytime wary whether accidentally miss assembly time. Under time pressure stomach probably not dare arbitrary. In addition no mobile phone accompany stomach not want work. At least these few weeks in boot camp times poop in camp area countable with fingers. Still comfortable poop at home.
Unforgettable People Since our squad too many people quarantined. Left five people have feeling sympathize with each other. Therefore first familiar with this group. Probably because this batch all Taipei soldiers. Most soldiers family background very good. Degree also very good. Have gangster but quantity compared other batches should be much less. Below record some unforgettable peers: Internal Affairs Fool Every unit definitely has fool exist. And our company same no exception. Most impressive is a certain fool internal affairs untidy let officer temper blow up event. Everyone living habit different. Someone likes tidy link. Someone used to chaotic environment. If happen not good at organizing. Then in army really very painful. That fool is member of rice squad. Usually rest time compared average person came less. Therefore didn’t organize internal affairs much. Helmet put randomly. Yellow Pu bag whole bag exposed outside bed. Quilt not folded inside still run out. Messy until same bed cannot stand. Neighbor also cannot save him. Naturally scolded by squad leader. Plus confession letter one sheet. Later slightly improved. But compared others still failed.
Gangster Army includes people of all shades. Also include some only junior high school graduated. Body tattoo dragon phoenix or carry several criminal records. Also because these people discover voluntary service standard actually quite strict. People with above situation voluntary service not accept. Usually these people will gather together smoke. Considered birds of a feather flock together. Average person rare chance contact them.
Once official duty accidentally heard them chat nearby. Discussing each other why caught need often run court. One said drunk driving caught. Another said gathering brawl heavy injury. Also one drug trafficking caught. Caught because drug user controlled by police want to hang drug dealer out. Before discovered him strange still forced go buy. He said don’t sell people point gun at you. Listen them talk can feel this society maybe not as bright and beautiful as we see. Still exist many dark corners. Family background not good or know wrong people easy make people go wrong way. These things if not come in serve army. Probably lifetime won’t hear personally.
Super High Degree Peer I thought NTU EE CS master already considered very good degree. But this batch degree really exceeded my expectation. Our squad has 17 people. Inside contain two NTU medicine department and one TMU medicine department. Two NTU graduated. Other only two people no university degree. If promotion is random sampling then really quite big deviation. Again explain Taipei soldier family background good. Also value education.
Peer Cannot Write Chinese Besides high degree peer. Also quite a lot people have study abroad experience. In our squad five people have study abroad experience. Someone high school go Germany exchange. Someone go study Lausanne Management Institute. Also someone go abroad research and study dentistry. More special is one from small study international school in Shanghai (heard therefore investigated background) then university go US study ABC. Although can speak Chinese but completely cannot read write Chinese. Therefore we need often help him translate translate. Besides often hear him talk about US things and discuss longing want go work in US in future. Let me also know quite a lot information during this period.
Conclusion One month plus boot camp. Days like years inside. Now look actually tooth bite passed. Later might still miss time chat all night with same bed. Sweat bayonet charge together. Complain officer days. Maybe because all wasting time doing same thing. If want me go again I certainly unwilling. Just entered still set many goals for self. Like physical fitness better. Weight lighter etc. After few days change mind live cool more important. Next batch after we left. Same unit had military training service accident. Now feel can safe discharge is luck….
Goodbye Chenggong Ridge~

A Google Interview Experience of an Ordinary Person Preface During my university years, AI technology was developing hotly. Therefore, there were frequent media reports about Google’s working environment, the leader of AI technology. Playground-like offices, endless snacks and drinks, five-star free meals, earning a million-dollar annual salary and sleeping whenever you want. Its internal fantasy refreshed my worldview of a job. Since then, I gradually became curious about this company. Although curious, I always held a wait-and-see attitude. The standard for admitting people to such a dream enterprise is naturally abnormally high. Ideally, they only accept bookworm gods or competition players from NTU EE/CS. Looking at my miserable school grades, I couldn’t imagine how to get a ticket to Google.
In my senior year, the department opened a corporate visit. The location was the Google I dreamed of. I signed up without hesitation, thus opening the fate of my first encounter with Google. At that time, the headquarters in Banqiao had not yet been established. We visited the headquarters located in 101. As the elevator to the 76th floor rose rapidly, the excitement was hard to suppress. The moment the elevator doors opened, I was greeted by the dream kingdom I dreamed of. It turned out that what the news said was true: free ice cream, free drinks, free five-star meals, coupled with the high-altitude view from the 76th floor, it really felt like a vacation. The amusement equipment and nap rooms were also real, fully reflecting Google’s trust in employees. After communicating with the employees leading us, I learned about the freedom of Google’s employee management. It is not only freedom in working hours, but employees also have considerable dominance over work items. Employees can even form small groups to initiate projects. Thus ended the first encounter with Google in shock. Since then, entering Google became my dream. I knew my shortcomings deeply and could only move towards there step by step. During the summer vacation of my senior year, I had an opportunity to go to San Francisco, USA. Taking this opportunity, I visited the dream place in my heart again, Google headquarters in Mountain View. However, this time it was a pity that I didn’t have connections to take me inside for a visit. I could only wander around the campus as a tourist. Although I could only look from the outside, I could feel the atmosphere of the entire company centered on Have Fun. Bicycles, beach volleyball courts, and various picnic areas everywhere were simply a large resort. Later I also went to the souvenir center near the campus to buy a lot of souvenirs. The pilgrimage trip made me feel the charming vitality of this company and the charm of Silicon Valley, the legendary place of the technology industry. With the creativity here and the changes brought to the world, I thought to myself that one day in the future, I also hope to come here to work. After returning to Taiwan, I entered graduate school. Originally, I didn’t have much confidence in my technical ability. After entering graduate school, I was surrounded by powerful people from all walks of life, which made me feel deeply that there is still a long way to go to enter Google. I must have a higher level of accumulation in technical ability and research ability. Holding this mentality, while being chased by research progress, I also participated in various side projects and hackathons as much as possible. I also participated in several startup projects and accumulated some experience in participating in startups. Amidst stumbling mixed with extraordinary luck, in the last year of graduate school, I was extremely lucky to get an internship opportunity at Microsoft, starting a year of life running between internship and graduate school. Although this old software company is slightly inferior to popular internet companies like Google and Facebook, as an old but evergreen tech giant, it still provided me with a lot of growth nutrients. The improvement of development technical ability and the cultivation of project management ability also allowed me to glimpse the life mode in technology companies.
In 2021, Google in Banqiao was established, which will be the largest hardware R&D center in Asia. What can be expected is that Google will have large-scale talent recruitment activities in Taiwan, and the difficulty of entering Google will be slightly easier than before. I deeply knew that this was a very good opportunity to enter Google. At the end of 2021, I received an interview invitation from Google HR on Linkedin for the first time. After interviewing with HR, I learned that this was a Hardware Engineer vacancy under Google Silicon, recruiting engineers with EE background or hardware development experience in Taiwan. It’s a pity that I had never learned hardware design and knew nothing about verilog. There was no follow-up news after the interview…
In early 2022, heard that a junior schoolmate entered Google. I cheekily asked him to help refer me and applied for the 2022 Software Engineer Campus Recruitment. This time I was finally not shut out and successfully got the opportunity for the first interview. Thus began the devil-level interview challenge journey.
Background Bachelor’s in Information Management double major in Forestry from NTU + Master’s from NTU Telecommunication Engineering. Never participated in programming competitions, nor contributed to open source projects. Only did Side Projects and Hackathons with a few friends. Failed Programming Design in sophomore year because spent too much time in clubs, retook it in junior year and passed with A+. Data Structures and Algorithms were only at an ordinary level.
Preparation Started grinding questions around December 2021. There was a period in between rushing research progress and wasting some time during Chinese New Year. After the New Year, to force myself to grind questions, I bought a one-year Leetcode Premium. It seems to be a very good investment now. In addition, I also bought the widely recommended Cracking the coding interview, but only read one or two chapters I wasn’t familiar with. My strategy for grinding questions in the early stage was starting from Dynamic Programming. At that time, I watched Huahua Jiang’s Dynamic Programming Ultimate Learning Strategy series videos to accumulate skills in thinking about DP problems. Around February, I started aiming to finish the first 100 Leetcode questions, starting from Easy, then Medium. In March, I started aiming to finish Blind 75. After finishing Blind 75 once, I went to look at the Hard questions in the first 100 questions. Finally, in the week before Onsite, I worked hard to grind Google interview high-frequency questions. I have to say Leetcode Premium organizing high-frequency questions is really convenient (and really quite useful XD). During this period, I would go up and write Daily every day, counting as forcing myself to maintain the feeling of solving problem every day. The number of questions ground was about 150 before Phone Interview, and about 230 before Onsite. Compared to various gods, it shouldn’t be considered much, but for myself it was enough. All types of questions were covered. My feeling was that I could stably solve Medium, and could come up with feasible solutions for Hard. It’s a pity that I didn’t find friends to help Mock interview during this time. The accumulation of interview experience relied on actual combat accumulation. Before this, I also interviewed with Amazon and Nvidia. Because Google’s Technical Interview will have at least two rounds of all-English interviews, English is also a very important part. Although it doesn’t need to be as fluent as a Native speaker, at least the logic must be conveyed correctly. My English part mainly relied on what I accumulated during the internship, including daily chat terms and ability to explain technology. I am very grateful to people who were willing to communicate with me and practice English with me during this time. Record of grinding questions during this period
Stats of grinding questions
Timeline 2022/01/20 -> Received friend’s referral notification email, submitted resume on official website, applied for Software Engineer, University Graduate, 2022 2022/03/07 -> Received email from HR notifying interview arrangement 2022/03/28 -> Phone Interview 2022/04/07 -> Notified passing Phone Interview, preparing to arrange Virtual Onsite Interview 2022/04/25 -> First day Virtual Onsite Interview, two rounds Technical Interview + one round Behavior Interview 2022/04/26 -> Second day Virtual Onsite Interview, two rounds Technical Interview 2022/05/07 -> Notified interview result most on positive 2022/05/26 -> Learned that Hiring policy might change
Process To say what needs most attention in the interview, I would feel it is to maintain a normal heart. This is also what I think is the most difficult part of the interview. After all, interviewing with your dream company, mixed emotions of excitement, expectation, nervousness etc., it is difficult to maintain a normal heart. During the first Phone Interview, I was even too nervous to sleep for the two nights before. What I could do was go to Youtube to find various videos of foreigners talking about software engineer interviews to watch, reminding myself of points to pay attention to in the interview. English ones could also practice English listening by the way. Here are a few recommended videos:
Interview Process Analysis, explaining software engineer interview in SOP way, simple & easy to understand Google Technical Interview Experience Sharing, this one explains the interview process and precautions very carefully, very valuable for reference How to tech interview Like a Pro, this presents the process of coding interview in a funny way, quite interesting Phone Interview I sat in front of the computer waiting about ten minutes before the scheduled time. However, the interviewer hadn’t come online when I clicked in at the scheduled time, which made me nervous thinking if I remembered the time wrong. After waiting for about ten minutes, the interviewer finally came, apologizing that a previous meeting delayed a bit. The interviewer was actually a kind Chinese young lady. Initially she asked a problem similar to string comparison, about Easy level. Basically I thought of the solution as soon as I saw the question. After stating the solution, the interviewer also agreed with this solution, so I spent about 10 minutes finishing coding this question. Then she indicated there was a Follow up, more like using the concept of the first question repeatedly, belonging to Medium level. When thinking about this question, I originally thought I just needed to reuse the solution of the first question, but found that my solution used in the first question was not the optimal solution. I panicked a bit here. Fortunately, the young lady was very nice, constantly guiding me to think of a better solution. Finally I came up with a better solution and spent a few minutes implementing it. Before the interview ended, the young lady indicated there was actually a better solution, so used another few minutes to ask for advice, but she indicated she hadn’t thought of this solution herself either. Personal evaluation: overall interview performance was okay, problem solving wasn’t very fluent, got stuck in the middle, but solved it, so not bad. Later passed this round of interview.
Onsite Interview Technical Interview #1 This round was a very nice Chinese uncle, didn’t arrive late either. Asked a variation of sorting problem. Initially thought it was Easy, but after actually solving it found it had Medium difficulty. Completely underestimated the depth of this question. Proposed a feasible solution at the very beginning, but the interviewer hoped I propose the optimal solution. Just like this, in the 30min of discussing solution, I proposed at least five or six solutions, and analyzed the difference in complexity under different input ranges, but I didn’t propose the optimal solution. Later with the interviewer’s hint I came up with the optimal solution, but time was basically used up. I could only quickly implement the idea. Later thinking back, the algorithm I implemented had Bugs. Fortunately the interviewer was very nice, didn’t rush to end the interview, instead tried to leave as much time as possible for me to finish the interview. Finally the interviewer responded that he thought this was a very interesting discussion, and thought I proposed many interesting ideas. With the experience of Phone Interview, I didn’t feel less nervous, instead was constantly worried the interviewer would come with a Hard question right away. In terms of the interview situation, I felt my performance was relatively terrible.
Technical Interview #2 This round was a young guy too lazy to talk. Asked a question similar to finding substring. He first asked me to think of a brute force solution. I basically had an idea and gave the solution right after reading the question. After he listened, he felt okay so asked me to implement. I spent about ten minutes implementing and explained the time complexity. Then he hoped I propose the optimal solution. I actually wasn’t confident about the optimal solution, only felt strings should be handled with prefix tree. So I proposed my idea. Unexpectedly he responded this was the correct line of thought. So continuing thinking I gave the optimal solution. Finished this round quite smoothly. Difficulty was about Medium. After bombing the first round, the mood in this round was much more relaxed. A bit of a “whatever” feeling. Probably because the mood was relaxed a lot, thoughts were clearer. Sure enough, nervousness is the big devil.
Behavior Interview This round was a Chinese sister interviewing. First asked some quite common Behavior questions like team cooperation and how to communicate. Detailed questions have detailed info online. More surprisingly, the interviewer asked a question somewhat similar to product design. Because I completely didn’t anticipate this beforehand, I could only answer by imagination. But felt the interviewer didn’t seem very satisfied. At the end of the interview, gave a feedback thinking my answer wasn’t very deep, but she thought I might lack work experience, so not answering deeply was also within expectation. Overall answering was acceptable, at least gave steady and moderate answers.
Technical Interview #3 Starting from the third round it became English interview. The interviewer was still a Chinese guy. Have to say communicating in English with someone whose mother tongue is also Chinese is really much lower difficulty. Maybe because the thinking behind is still stuck in Chinese framework. The interviewer asked a tree traverse and output path question, highly similar to a Google high-frequency question on leetcode. Just happened to write it when grinding questions a few days ago. Almost instantly thought of optimal solution. Of course seeing original question was very exciting. Spent about 15 minutes explaining and finishing coding. Then the interviewer gave me a follow up. Superficially it was an extension of the above question, but actually already transformed into BFS finding shortest path between two points question. Quite an interesting Follow up. This variation couldn’t be found on leetcode. This question was also medium difficulty.
Technical Interview #4 The fourth round was a Chinese guy without much expression. Asked a question similar to blind 75 pacific atlantic water flow. First reaction after reading question linked to this blind 75 question. Afterwards also proved using same method could solve this question. Spent about 20 minutes explaining and finishing code. Then interviewer also gave a follow-up. But this follow-up wasn’t as interesting as previous round, just simple increase in quantity. Solved by modifying code slightly using same method. This question difficulty about Medium. Result was instead this interviewer thought the code I wrote had slight flaws. Sure enough, seeing familiar questions still cannot be too careless.
Follow-up My interview time was valid as the tail end of Google 2022 Campus Hire. Most vacancies were already filled. So later it became directly no Headcount to proceed with Team match. So at that time I was mentally prepared to wait until next year’s campus hire to continue.
Later as everyone saw, under the pressure of US interest rate hikes, major companies began to be forced to streamline manpower. The campus hire in Taiwan was also delayed until November to start, and headcount would have to wait until early next year after manpower policy is confirmed to be more certain. Fortunately interview results can be kept for one year. Just pray next year there are still opportunities to continue the interview process.
Although I haven’t successfully entered my Dream company, I am still very grateful for opportunities and help provided by many people along the way. Also thanks to the Google HR assisting me for tirelessly providing various info on recruitment process.

Playing with Vintage Lenses - Leica Summicron-C 40mm f2 Preface In this era, poor students who want to play with the M system have many choices. Cheap and affordable 7Artisans, TTArtisan; diverse choices of Voigtländer; Zeiss whose image quality is not inferior to Leica at all; there are even flocks of ancient times M mount, L39 mount vintage lenses to choose from. Most 50mm focal lengths can be collected for just over 10,000, each is very good, each is full of stories.
One rainy afternoon in 2020, nesting in the darkroom developing films, while exchanging equipment with other club members. I still remember a friend mysteriously took out his Leica M3 from his bag for me to touch. That heavy feel, solid shutter, suddenly understood why it is said once touched cannot go back. For several nights after going back, I was always thinking about this camera. Before long, I also bought the first Leica film camera in my life. Just buying it spent most of my savings. Could only casually get a 7Artisans 35mm f2 to fill hunger. Even though outsiders say how high the CP value of this lens is, heart was still very unsatisfied. And indeed photos taken were also very ordinary. Used Leica body, anyway have to match a Leica original lens. At least I want to experience what is called “German flavor” what is called Leica aesthetics.
Later encountered this Leica Summicron-C 40mm f2 on online trading platform. Condition not considered too good, paint loss coating scratches etc. problems all exist. Price therefore not too expensive, impression is around 14,000. Honest German made, Leica design.
Introduction This lens originally took a low price route. Mainly designed for use with Leica’s M system budget model Leica CL at that time. Leica CL is also a camera with quite a story. In Leica’s most desolate era, cooperated with Minolta to produce body with more electronic parts to attract users. Coping to let more people feel charm of Leica and purchase other Leica products. Result public instead only willing to purchase lower priced Leica CL and not willing to purchase Leica M5 at that time. Had to let Leica discontinue this camera early. And Summicron-C 40mm also only produced for few generations with camera then discontinued. Although said only produced for few generations, but production volume still quite large. Still considered easy to see on market today. Smaller body compared to other M models also makes many people love.
[1]
Although said budget model, but imaging of this Summicron-C 40mm is still not bad. Also considered comparable to other standard lenses of Leica at that time. Therefore everyone would rather buy this budget model. Materials of this lens are also comparable to other Leica lenses. Specifications as follows:
Number: 11542 Production Years: 1973-1979 Quantity: 54,350 Mount: M mount Lens: 6 elements in 4 groups Aperture: f/2 - f/16, 10 blades Weight: 120g Speaking of this lens, some people will call it Small Seven Elements or Poor Man’s Seven Elements. Nothing but similar focal length seeking a good name. But personally think there is still quite a gap with real Seven Elements. To say closer should be Leica Six Elements. Two lenses both are Double Gauss 6 elements in 4 groups structure. Production years also very close (1971-1979). In coating technology should also be very close. Except focal length difference two lenses actually very similar. Just pity Six Elements always jokingly called cost down version of Eight Elements after all lacking 2 elements. And produced in Leica’s most desolate era. Back to Summicron-C 40mm. Using 1/2 price of Six Elements to buy optical comparable to Six Elements. Doesn’t it smell good? The C on nameplate marked its fate. Hard not to let people think of Cheap. Just like iPhone 5c (people who can say this phone seem not young anymore).
[2] Volume is also big advantage of this lens. This lens can completely be called pancake lens. Volume even smaller than those Color-Skopar lenses produced by Voigtländer. And and and also have f2 aperture. As far as I know, this should also be smallest Summicron lens in Leica lens group. Have to admire Leica’s ability to play with Double Gauss structure.
Because it is too excellent (too similar to Six Elements). Leica had to do a little modification to it. One is filter thread although same 39mm but cannot use normal 39mm filter but use special S5.5 pitch filter. But want force generic 39mm filter also can. Just might damage screw thread. Or cannot take down. In addition this lens also matched with hood. But is rubber made retractable hood. Maybe convenient but really ugly. When I collected lens didn’t attach this hood. If have I probably won’t install either. Later found a replica Leica hood install on. Appearance looks decent. I am a person won’t use lens cap if have hood. Forgetting to take down lens cap on rangefinder camera really nightmare. Having hood somewhat can prevent me touching lens.
Another difference is mount. If this lens installed on M body will automatically bring out 50mm frameline. One saying is small mechanism Leica made to make this lens harder use on M body. However this small mechanism can be avoided through a little manual work. That is grind off bottom lug in picture a little can let it bring out 35mm frameline. Leica’s 35mm frameline is closer to 40mm focal length. Therefore having 35mm frameline will be much convenient.
Other differences like focus tab different from traditional crescent changed to a peculiar triangle. Aperture ring carries a little damping. However each Leica lens aperture feel not quite same. Even same series lenses have little gap. Worthy of purely hand assembled and tuned lens. Next lets see how this lens actually shoots.
Sample Shots First use Portra take few shots. Try how strongest negative film performs Can discover under sufficient light condition. Lens sharpness, bokeh basically no need worry
Portrait performance under low light still very good. Can note when aperture fully open. Small halo will appear in bright parts. May come from defect of coating technology in that era. Some people also call Holy Light.
Use valvia 100f take few more. Try performance on positive film Indoor performance also very good. Color thick flavor
Change scene try how landscape Finally landscape on Provia 100f positive film
Conclusion As my first Leica lens. It accompanied me walk through many places. I also used it record many memories. Have to say it is a good lens. Also let me know Leica aesthetics through it. But it also has slight drawbacks. Like not near not far 40mm focal length, Holy Light etc. Later after acquiring Summicron-M 35mm ASPH resold Summicron-C 40mm. After all optical performance of two still has large gap. Still look forward one day in future have chance buy back this lens full of memories for me.

Mechanical Camera Series - Hasselblad A12 Magazine Loading Method Preface A while ago, I was pushed into the pit by a friend and bought a Hasselblad 500cm + CB 60mm 3.5f. As a medium format film SLR camera, the exquisiteness of its mechanical structure goes without saying. Even if not taking it out, playing with it in hands is still very enjoyable. Looking through the viewfinder, the optical beauty of Zeiss is revealed completely. The only drawback is that the huge body and weight are really inconvenient to take out. Bought it for a while but it has been kept in the dry box by me. Recently, I finally made up my mind to use it to take good photos. On a whim, I recorded how to use the Hasselblad A12 magazine to change film. For a novice using Hasselblad photography for the first time, I was surprised to find that there are many details to pay attention to. It is completely unlike 135 film cameras which are brainless. One careless mistake may destroy a roll of film and 12 hard-earned photographic works.
A black painted Hasselblad 500cm collected from an old master. Most people's impression of Hasselblad is the silver stainless steel outer edge, which has the beauty of classical crafts. The all-black Hasselblad has a modern feel and is more low-key. CB 60mm 3.5f was purchased from Pinkuan Photography. Originally wanted to match a mediocre 80mm, but the price of 80mm on the market was too scary at that time. CB 60mm is a high CP value choice. Sharpness and distortion are perfect. The viewing angle is also close to the 35mm lens of 135 format, but the actual shooting perspective is completely different.
Start Loading Film Remove Magazine First thing to do is remove the magazine from the body. Slide the round button on the magazine to the left side of the picture to unlock the latch and remove the magazine. Note that if the dark slide is not inserted back into the magazine, the latch cannot be moved. Forcing it may cause mechanical damage. After removing the magazine, be careful not to touch the two door-like light shields behind the body, otherwise damaging them causing light leakage will not be fun.
Pull Out Magazine Insert Next, take out the magazine insert inside. But before taking it out, be sure to check if there is still film inside. If there is, confirm if it has finished rewinding. If you rashly take out the magazine insert, it will cause the film inside to be exposed to light, which would be miserable. Then just turn the knob on one side of the magazine from the left appearance to the right appearance and pull outward to pull out the magazine insert. Sometimes it may not be pulled out, mostly because the dark slide is inserted backwards and stuck the magazine insert, so remember the dark slide also has directionality.
Exchange Spool The extracted magazine insert looks like this. The one originally on the left is the old spool, which needs to be moved to the right. So don’t lose the old spool. If lost, you can only go to ask film developing shop for one. After Hasselblad magazine finishes shooting, it will rewind the film to the old spool, so every time the spool of the last film shot will be left.
Film Today I am loading Kodak’s Portra 400 film. This roll should be one of the few satisfying films in the era of diminishing film types. Color latitude and detail are much better than the new Gold 200, and 400 ISO can provide relatively higher shutter speed. Except for the high price, it should be the first choice for 120 color.
After opening the 120 film package, need to tear off the paper seal outside the film. The pulled out section is actually not film but backing paper, which is the biggest difference between 120 film and 135 film. Because 120 film has no shell, to prevent accidental exposure of film, need to rely on backing paper for light shielding. The real film is sandwiched in the middle of backing paper. Pulling to a certain position will pull out the real film together. The real film and backing paper are stuck together with a piece of paper tape. For detailed structure, can refer to this article: 120 Film Structure.
Install Film First we install the film to the right side where the spool was originally placed. Please note the direction the backing paper is pulled out, it is pulled out from below. Do not install the film direction backwards. Then pull the backing paper to the back of the magazine insert.
After wrapping the backing paper to the back, please note that there is a structure on the magazine insert for clamping the backing paper. This structure is clamped tight when the magazine insert is pulled out. We need to turn the knob of the magazine insert back to the original position first so that this backing paper clamping structure will loosen, making it convenient for the backing paper to pass from below.
After the backing paper passes, turn the knob of the magazine insert back to the open state, this structure will clamp the backing paper again.
Pass the end of the backing paper through the hole in the center of the old spool.
Finally we rotate the knob below the spool on the other side to tighten the backing paper. Continue rotating until the START arrow (not necessarily have START) appears on the new film side. This arrow will align with the red arrow on the magazine. This completes the film installation.
Reinstall Magazine Insert When reinstalling please note the position of the magazine insert knob. Need to tighten the backing paper clamping mechanism so the magazine insert can be installed into the magazine. After installing, turn the knob back to original position to complete magazine insert installation.
Hasselblad magazine needs to pre-roll film to the last frame. Can be understood as Hasselblad magazine starts shooting from the last frame. Therefore need to rotate the crank on the other side of magazine until the number 1 appears in the small window at the bottom left of magazine.
Finally install the magazine back to the body and can start shooting. Remember to confirm the body is already cocked when installing back to body, otherwise installing magazine then cocking will make film shoot one less frame.
Remember to pull out magazine dark slide when shooting, otherwise shutter cannot be pressed.
Picture looking through viewfinder, Zeiss optical imaging is really beautiful.
